data.title: Institutional Payments
data.meta_description: Many institutions have agreements with Wiley which allow them to help affiliated authors with open access article publication charges (APCs). These agreements are known as Wiley Open Access Accounts.
data.text:
Australia and New Zealand

Commonwealth Scientific and Industrial Research Organisation (CSIRO)

Article publication charges (APCs) for primary research and review articles published by responsible corresponding authors formally affiliated with CSIRO will be covered as part of CSIRO Library Serviceâs agreement with Wiley. Articles must be accepted for publication in a hybrid journal or submitted to a fully open access journal on or after 1 January 2022. For further information contact askalibrarian@csiro.au.

Council of Australian University Librarians (CAUL) Member Institutions Responsible corresponding authors currently affiliated with the following institutions can publish open access with no article publication charges (APCs), as part of an agreement negotiated by the Council of Australian University Librarians with Wiley. Articles must be accepted for publication in a hybrid journal on or after 1 January 2022, or submitted to a fully open access journal on or after 1 January 2023 to be eligible for coverage.

Responsible corresponding authors should use an institutional email address for a CAUL member institution when submitting their articles' APC coverage request. You may need to update your Wiley profile to do so. Personal email addresses (e.g. Hotmail, Gmail) or email addresses for other institutions should not be used. Doing so may result in delayed approval of the open access APC coverage request of the article to be published open access under the terms of the agreement. Responsible corresponding authors applying to CAUL institutions for APC funding coverage for their articles should also ensure that the published version of their articles include the funding institutions in their listed affiliations.

Botswana

SANLiC Member Institutions

Article publication charges (APCs) for primary research and review articles published by corresponding authors affiliated with SANLiC institutions will be covered as part of SANLiC's agreement with Wiley. To qualify, articles must be published in a fully open access journal (submitted on or after 1 January 2023) or published open access in a hybrid journal (accepted on or after 1 January 2023).

University of Botswana For more information, visit the Open access for authors in South Africa, Namibia and Botswana page.

Canada

Canadian Research Knowledge Network (CRKN) Member Institutions

Article Publication Charges (APCs) for primary research and review articles published by corresponding authors affiliated with CRKN institutions will be covered as part of CRKN's agreement with Wiley. To qualify, articles must be published open access in a hybrid journal and must have been accepted on or after January 1, 2024.

Eligible corresponding authors should use an institutional email address for their CRKN member institution when submitting their article. You may need to update your Wiley profile to do so. Personal email addresses (e.g. Hotmail, Gmail) or email addresses for non-CRKN institutions should not be used. Authors should also specify their CRKN member institution when asked to declare affiliation during the Wiley Author Services process. Failure to do so may result in delayed approval or rejection of the open access APC coverage request under the terms of the agreement.
